cmrd-nova@internet:~$ ░

hello! online, i go by cmdr_nova, but i've also been known to go by "ryan" face-to-face. i'm 39 years old, & have been a "creator" of sorts for as long as i can remember. i currently reside in pennsylvania & have been working retail & customer service most of my natural born adult life. but, when i was only sixteen years old, i began messing with html as a hobby, for fun, on a little thing some of us know as geocities. from there, & that point forward, i never stopped being a maker, & a creator.

i am a:

  • writer
  • musician
  • designer
  • coder
  • linux enjoyer
skilled & practiced in:
  • creative & informational writing
  • fl studio, sample creation, sample & sound manipulation, & general sound design
  • photoshop (adobe suite) & gimp in graphic design
  • blender, marvelous designer, zbrush, & quixel
  • networking & computing hardware
  • html5, css (sass, less), javascript (react, angular)
  • version control (git), github (in-general)
  • openshot video editing
learning:
  • python
  • typescript

email: cmdr-nova@mkultra.monster

akkoma: @daemon_nova

professional: linkedin

websites:

░ NOVA PRIME : my personal website, a blog filled with hours, weeks, & months of written text, in the style of a purposely de-modernized theme with a slight mixture of actual modern code (think, if geocities met css & javascript).

the current iteration of nova prime was developed by deploying a build of jekyll's minima theme (via ruby) as a static site, and then i systematically dismantled it until it was my own site. see the github repository for a look into the chaos.

░ NOVA PRIME (OLD VERSION) : the old version of my website that came before what this portfolio is attached to. basically the same thing, but a bit more rough and brightly colored.

this version of nova prime as hand-written via many, many, pieces of frankensteined code.

░ LINKGARDEN : i recognized the need to have a landing page where people could immediately see my most important links, content i'm working on, and where to find me--without an entire website of novels-worth of text in their way. and then this gave me an idea: hey, self, this is something a lot of people use, and also, a lot of them are paying some service on a monthly basis to have something that's relatively simple to code, and display. therein, linkgarden was born.

music:

░ EYESHADOW 2600 FM : a body of work created from the years of 2017 to 2023, from experimental garbage-electronic, to full-on darksynth, electro, & ambient.

░ PLEXX : my latest venture into continuing most of the same trends, with a dash of nineties liminal horror.

scripts:

░ THE DAILY REPORT : a python script that picks from a list of defined subreddits, and then sends you an email of the top 5 trending posts. this is best used as a cronjob, scheduled daily.

░ REDDIT BOT : a python script that picks from a list of subreddits and looks through the top 50 trending posts (image posts only), and then posts just one, at random, to an automated mastodon account. also best used as a cronjob for continual posts, but can absolutely be used to post whenever you want with one command.

░ BLOG POSTER : a python script that reads your RSS feed, and posts new items it finds to both mastodon and a discord channel, and upon first run, adds all current items to a json in order to avoid spamming and posting old content.

░ CHATTER BOT : a python script that posts random defined status messages to mastodon, and also replies to mentions with random predefined statuses.

░ POST GEN BOT : a python script that generates random posts for mastodon, derived specifically from google sheets.

░ SL ONLINE : a python script that reads online data from second life, and posts that data to a specified mastodon account.

░ ANTI WEBP : a python script that runs on a cronjob and converts any .webp images in your linux downloads folder to a .png instead.

░ POAST : an absolutely convoluted mess of a script that runs via a github workflow, and then through python on a vps, in order to post your jekyll blog posts directly to mastodon.

apps:

░ EXTUBE : a desktop app that exists as a single executable, and can be used to extract youtube videos with just a url, and your choice of directory navigation.

░ GRIDSTREAM : an app that acts as a feed reader, either via an executable, or in your browser (from the command line). Has features such as being able to make folders, rename folders, add feeds to folders, and more.

░ GRAMLOAD : a linux/python desktop app that can download entire instagram profiles at the click of a button.

web elements:

░ GUESTPOAST : a guestbook that runs on javascript and remote python, so that you can have a guestbook on your website without the need for third party services that want all of your data. vps / server required.

░ JEKYLL-TAG-GENERATOR : a jekyll specific script that you can use in conjunction with blog posts in order to autogenerate tag-pages, with no need to do it manually ever again.

░ JEKYLL-COMMENTS : a simple, and also fairly complicated system to put completely active and live comments onto a static site, like jekyll, by utilizing server-side python and javascript, which also e-mails you with new comments.

3d design:

░ [REVOSA] & Ayashi Systems : from 2015, & to the present, i have practiced, exercised, & executed skills in graphic & 3d design in order to build & maintain multiple virtual stores within the world of second life.

games:

░ ETERNAL : a simple javascript game, where there is no goal and there are no objectives. you fly through the infinite void of space, either while listening to music, or without. runs on desktop and mobile.

contributions:

░ WAFRN : i have and am currently actively contributing to wafrn, an activitypub federated social app that mimics the style of tumblr.
